content: Recipe: Italian - Spaghetti Carbonara. A classic Roman pasta dish. Ingredients: 200g spaghetti, 100g pancetta or guanciale, 2 large egg yolks, 1 whole egg, 50g grated Pecorino Romano cheese, black pepper. Instructions: 1. Cook spaghetti until al dente. 2. Fry pancetta until crisp. 3. Whisk eggs and cheese in a bowl. 4. Drain pasta (reserving some water) and mix with pancetta. 5. Off the heat, quickly stir in the egg mixture to create a creamy sauce, adding pasta water if needed. Serve with extra pepper.

Recipe: Japanese - Chicken Teriyaki. A simple and flavorful dish. Ingredients: 2 boneless chicken thighs, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup mirin, 2 tbsp sake, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 tsp grated ginger. Instructions: 1. Pan-sear chicken thighs skin-down until crisp. 2. Flip and cook until done. 3. In a small pot, combine soy sauce, mirin, sake, sugar, and ginger. Simmer until the sauce thickens slightly. 4. Pour the sauce over the chicken and let it glaze. Slice and serve over rice.

Recipe: Mexican - Guacamole. The perfect avocado dip. Ingredients: 3 ripe avocados, 1 lime (juiced), 1/2 red onion (finely diced), 1 jalapeño (minced), 1/4 cup chopped cilantro, salt to taste. Instructions: 1. Mash avocados in a bowl, leaving it slightly chunky. 2. Stir in lime juice, red onion, jalapeño, and cilantro. 3. Season generously with salt. Serve immediately with tortilla chips.

Recipe: Indian - Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani). A rich and creamy chicken curry. Ingredients: 500g boneless chicken, 1 cup tomato puree, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 1/4 cup yogurt, 2 tbsp butter, 1 onion, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, spices (garam masala, turmeric, cumin). Instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for at least 30 minutes. 2. In a pan, melt butter and sauté onion and ginger-garlic paste. 3. Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates. 4. Add the marinated chicken and cook until done. 5. Stir in heavy cream and simmer for 5 minutes. Serve hot with naan bread.

Recipe: Thai - Green Curry with Chicken (Gaeng Keow Wan Gai). A fragrant and spicy curry. Ingredients: 400ml coconut milk, 2 tbsp green curry paste, 500g chicken breast (sliced), 1 cup bamboo shoots, 1 red bell pepper (sliced), Thai basil leaves. Instructions: 1. In a wok, heat half the coconut milk until the oil separates. 2. Add green curry paste and fry until fragrant. 3. Add chicken and cook through. 4. Add the remaining coconut milk, bamboo shoots, and bell pepper. Simmer until vegetables are tender. 5. Stir in Thai basil leaves before serving with jasmine rice.

Recipe: French - Coq au Vin. A classic chicken stew with red wine. Ingredients: 1 whole chicken (cut into pieces), 1 bottle of red wine (like Burgundy), 200g bacon lardons, 250g mushrooms, 1 onion, carrots, garlic, thyme. Instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in red wine overnight with onion, carrots, and garlic. 2. The next day, remove chicken and pat dry. Brown the chicken in a pot. 3. Sauté bacon and mushrooms. 4. Return chicken to the pot, add the marinade liquid, and simmer for 1.5-2 hours until tender. Thicken sauce if necessary.

Recipe: Spanish - Paella Valenciana. The traditional Spanish rice dish. Ingredients: 300g short-grain rice (like Bomba), 500g chicken pieces, 200g rabbit pieces, 1 cup green beans, 1 tomato (grated), saffron threads, paprika, rosemary, 1L chicken broth. Instructions: 1. In a paella pan, brown the chicken and rabbit. 2. Add green beans and sauté. 3. Add grated tomato and paprika and cook for a minute. 4. Pour in the broth, add saffron and rosemary, and bring to a boil. 5. Sprinkle in the rice evenly. Do not stir. Cook for 18-20 minutes until liquid is absorbed and a crust (socarrat) forms at the bottom.

Recipe: Greek - Moussaka. A layered eggplant and meat casserole. Ingredients: 2 large eggplants, 500g ground lamb, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 cup tomato sauce, cinnamon, oregano. For Béchamel: 4 tbsp butter, 4 tbsp flour, 2 cups milk, nutmeg, Parmesan cheese. Instructions: 1. Slice and grill or fry eggplant slices until golden. 2. Sauté onion and garlic, add ground lamb and cook until browned. Stir in tomato sauce and spices. 3. Prepare Béchamel sauce. 4. In a baking dish, layer eggplant, meat sauce, and repeat. Top with Béchamel sauce and Parmesan. 5. Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 45 minutes until golden brown.

Recipe: Chinese - Kung Pao Chicken. A spicy, stir-fried chicken dish from Sichuan province. Ingredients: 500g chicken breast (diced), 1/2 cup peanuts, dried red chilies, Sichuan peppercorns, scallions, ginger, garlic. For Sauce: soy sauce, black vinegar, sugar, cornstarch. Instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in soy sauce and cornstarch. 2. Heat oil in a wok, fry peanuts until golden and remove. 3. Stir-fry dried chilies and Sichuan peppercorns until fragrant. 4. Add chicken and cook until done. 5. Add scallions, ginger, and garlic. Pour in the sauce and stir until it thickens. 6. Mix in the peanuts and serve.

Recipe: American - Classic Beef Chili. A hearty and comforting stew. Ingredients: 500g ground beef, 1 onion (chopped), 2 cloves garlic (minced), 1 can (400g) kidney beans, 1 can (400g) diced tomatoes, 2 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin. Instructions: 1. In a large pot, brown the ground beef with onion and garlic. 2. Drain excess fat. 3. Stir in diced tomatoes, chili powder, and cumin. Bring to a simmer. 4. Cover and cook on low for at least 1 hour. 5. Add kidney beans and cook for another 15 minutes. Serve with sour cream and cheese.

Recipe: Vietnamese - Pho Bo (Beef Noodle Soup). A fragrant and complex soup. Ingredients: 1kg beef bones, 500g beef brisket, star anise, cinnamon stick, cloves, ginger, onion, rice noodles, bean sprouts, basil, lime. Instructions: 1. Char ginger and onion. 2. Simmer beef bones for 6-8 hours with charred aromatics and spices to create the broth. 3. Cook rice noodles. 4. Thinly slice cooked brisket and raw sirloin. 5. To serve, place noodles in a bowl, top with meat, and pour hot broth over it. Garnish with fresh herbs.

Recipe: Korean - Bibimbap. A mixed rice bowl. Ingredients: Cooked rice, assorted vegetables (carrots, spinach, zucchini), beef bulgogi, a fried egg, gochujang (chili paste). Instructions: 1. Sauté each vegetable separately. 2. Cook beef bulgogi. 3. Fry an egg sunny-side up. 4. Assemble the bowl: place rice at the bottom, arrange vegetables and meat on top, add the egg in the center, and serve with a dollop of gochujang. Mix everything together before eating.

Recipe: German - Sauerbraten. A pot roast, known for its sour marinade. Ingredients: 1.5kg beef roast, 2 cups red wine vinegar, 2 cups water, onions, carrots, bay leaves, cloves, gingersnaps for gravy. Instructions: 1. Marinate the beef in vinegar, water, and spices for 2-3 days in the refrigerator. 2. Remove beef, pat dry, and brown on all sides. 3. Sauté vegetables, add the marinade liquid, and simmer the beef for 3-4 hours until tender. 4. Remove beef, strain the liquid, and thicken with crushed gingersnaps to make the gravy.

Recipe: Brazilian - Feijoada. A rich black bean and pork stew. Ingredients: 500g black beans, various cuts of pork (sausage, ribs, bacon), onion, garlic, bay leaves. Served with rice, collard greens, and farofa (toasted cassava flour). Instructions: 1. Soak black beans overnight. 2. Cook the beans with pork cuts and bay leaves until everything is tender (2-3 hours). 3. In a separate pan, sauté onion and garlic and add to the stew. 4. Season and simmer until thick. Serve with traditional accompaniments.

Recipe: Peruvian - Lomo Saltado. A beef stir-fry with a fusion of Peruvian and Chinese influences. Ingredients: 500g beef sirloin (sliced), 1 red onion (sliced), 2 tomatoes (wedged), 1 aji amarillo (chili, sliced), soy sauce, vinegar, french fries, rice. Instructions: 1. Marinate beef in soy sauce and vinegar. 2. In a hot wok, sear the beef quickly. 3. Add onions, tomatoes, and aji amarillo and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes. 4. Mix in cooked french fries. 5. Serve immediately with a side of white rice.

Recipe: English - Shepherd's Pie. A savory pie with a lamb filling and potato topping. Ingredients: 500g ground lamb, 1 onion, carrots, peas, beef broth, Worcestershire sauce. For topping: 1kg potatoes, butter, milk. Instructions: 1. Sauté onion and carrots, add ground lamb and brown. 2. Stir in flour, beef broth, Worcestershire sauce, and peas. Simmer until thickened. 3. Boil, mash, and season potatoes. 4. Place meat filling in a baking dish, top with mashed potatoes. 5. Bake at 200°C (400°F) for 20-25 minutes until golden.

Recipe: Russian - Beef Stroganoff. A classic dish of sautéed beef in a sour cream sauce. Ingredients: 500g beef sirloin (thinly sliced), 250g mushrooms (sliced), 1 onion (chopped), 1 cup beef broth, 1 cup sour cream, 2 tbsp flour, butter. Instructions: 1. Toss beef with flour, salt, and pepper. 2. In a skillet, brown the beef in butter and set aside. 3. Sauté onions and mushrooms until soft. 4. Stir in beef broth and bring to a simmer. 5. Reduce heat, stir in sour cream, and return beef to the pan. Heat through but do not boil. Serve over egg noodles.

Recipe: Moroccan - Chicken Tagine with Lemons and Olives. A fragrant slow-cooked stew. Ingredients: 1 whole chicken (cut up), 2 preserved lemons, 1 cup green olives, 1 onion, ginger, garlic, turmeric, cumin, saffron. Instructions: 1. Brown the chicken pieces in a tagine or Dutch oven. 2. Add onion, garlic, ginger, and spices, and cook until fragrant. 3. Add water or broth, preserved lemons, and olives. 4. Cover and simmer on low heat for 1-1.5 hours until chicken is very tender. Serve with couscous.

Recipe: Turkish - Doner Kebab. Meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie. Home version: Ingredients: 500g ground lamb/beef, yogurt, garlic, onion juice, paprika, cumin, oregano. Instructions: 1. Mix meat with spices and yogurt. Form into a compact log and freeze for several hours. 2. Thinly slice the frozen meat log. 3. Pan-fry the meat slices until crispy. 4. Serve in pita bread with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and garlic sauce.

Recipe: Indonesian - Nasi Goreng. A popular fried rice dish. Ingredients: 3 cups cooked rice (day-old), 2 eggs, chicken or shrimp, shallots, garlic, chili, kecap manis (sweet soy sauce). Instructions: 1. Sauté shallots, garlic, and chili. 2. Add chicken/shrimp and cook through. 3. Push everything to one side, add eggs and scramble. 4. Add rice and kecap manis. Stir-fry on high heat until everything is well-mixed and heated through. Serve with a fried egg on top.

Recipe: Italian - Risotto alla Milanese. A creamy saffron risotto. Ingredients: 300g Arborio rice, 1L chicken broth (hot), 1 small onion (finely chopped), 1 pinch of saffron threads, 1/2 cup dry white wine, 50g Parmesan cheese, butter. Instructions: 1. Sauté onion in butter. 2. Add rice and toast for 1-2 minutes. 3. Pour in wine and cook until absorbed. 4. Add saffron to the hot broth. 5. Add broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly and waiting for it to be absorbed before adding more. 6. After 18-20 mins, rice should be creamy. Stir in Parmesan and a knob of butter.

Recipe: Japanese - Sushi Rolls (Maki). A staple of Japanese cuisine. Ingredients: Sushi rice, nori (seaweed sheets), fillings (e.g., raw tuna, cucumber, avocado), rice vinegar, sugar, salt. Instructions: 1. Cook and season sushi rice. 2. Place a nori sheet on a bamboo mat. 3. Spread a thin layer of rice on the nori. 4. Place your fillings in a line across the center. 5. Tightly roll the sushi using the mat. 6. Slice the roll into 6-8 pieces with a sharp, wet knife.

Recipe: Mexican - Tacos al Pastor. Spit-grilled pork tacos. Home version: Ingredients: 500g pork shoulder (thinly sliced), achiote paste, pineapple juice, vinegar, chili powder. For serving: corn tortillas, pineapple chunks, onion, cilantro. Instructions: 1. Marinate pork in achiote mixture for at least 4 hours. 2. Stack the pork slices and grill or pan-fry until cooked and slightly charred. 3. Chop the cooked pork. 4. Serve on warm corn tortillas with grilled pineapple, diced onion, and cilantro.

Recipe: Indian - Palak Paneer. A spinach and cottage cheese curry. Ingredients: 250g paneer (cubed), 500g spinach (blanched and pureed), 1 onion, 1 tomato, ginger-garlic paste, cream, garam masala. Instructions: 1. Lightly fry paneer cubes until golden and set aside. 2. Sauté onion, then add ginger-garlic paste and tomato. Cook until soft. 3. Add spinach puree and spices. Simmer for 10 minutes. 4. Stir in paneer and a splash of cream. Cook for another 2 minutes.

Recipe: Thai - Pad Thai. A classic stir-fried noodle dish. Ingredients: Rice noodles, shrimp or chicken, tofu, bean sprouts, peanuts, lime, egg. For sauce: fish sauce, tamarind paste, palm sugar, chili. Instructions: 1. Soak rice noodles until soft. 2. In a hot wok, stir-fry shrimp/chicken and tofu. 3. Push to one side and scramble an egg. 4. Add noodles and sauce. Toss until noodles are cooked. 5. Add bean sprouts and chives. Serve topped with crushed peanuts and a wedge of lime.

Recipe: French - Boeuf Bourguignon. A rich beef and red wine stew. Ingredients: 1kg stewing beef (cubed), 1 bottle of red Burgundy wine, beef broth, bacon, pearl onions, mushrooms, carrots, garlic. Instructions: 1. Brown the beef in batches and set aside. 2. Sauté bacon, onions, and carrots. 3. Return beef to the pot, sprinkle with flour, and cook for a minute. 4. Pour in wine and broth. Add garlic and herbs. 5. Cover and simmer for 2-3 hours until beef is tender. 6. Sauté mushrooms separately and add to the stew before serving.

Recipe: Spanish - Gambas al Ajillo. Garlic shrimp. Ingredients: 500g shrimp (peeled), 6 cloves garlic (thinly sliced), 1 dried chili, 1/2 cup olive oil, parsley. Instructions: 1. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. 2. Add garlic and chili, and cook until garlic is golden but not burnt. 3. Add shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes until pink and cooked through. 4. Sprinkle with fresh parsley and serve immediately with crusty bread.

Recipe: Greek - Spanakopita. A savory spinach pie. Ingredients: 500g spinach, 200g feta cheese, 1 onion, fresh dill, 1 egg, phyllo pastry, butter. Instructions: 1. Sauté onion, then add spinach and cook until wilted. Squeeze out excess water. 2. Mix spinach with crumbled feta, dill, and a beaten egg. 3. Layer sheets of phyllo pastry in a baking dish, brushing each with melted butter. 4. Spread the spinach filling over the phyllo. 5. Top with more layers of buttered phyllo. 6. Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 30-40 minutes until golden.

Recipe: Chinese - Mapo Tofu. A spicy tofu dish from Sichuan. Ingredients: 1 block soft tofu (cubed), 150g ground pork, doubanjiang (spicy bean paste), Sichuan peppercorns, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, chili oil. Instructions: 1. Briefly blanch tofu cubes in salt water. 2. Stir-fry ground pork until crispy. 3. Add doubanjiang, garlic, and ginger. 4. Add broth or water and bring to a simmer. Gently add the tofu. 5. Thicken sauce with a cornstarch slurry. Stir in chili oil and ground Sichuan peppercorns.

Recipe: American - Macaroni and Cheese. A creamy baked pasta dish. Ingredients: 500g macaroni, 50g butter, 50g flour, 1L milk, 500g sharp cheddar cheese (grated), breadcrumbs. Instructions: 1. Cook macaroni until al dente. 2. Make a béchamel sauce with butter, flour, and milk. 3. Off the heat, stir in most of the grated cheddar until melted. 4. Combine the cheese sauce with the cooked macaroni. 5. Pour into a baking dish, top with remaining cheese and breadcrumbs. 6. Bake at 190°C (375°F) for 20-25 minutes.

Recipe: Vietnamese - Banh Mi. A flavorful Vietnamese sandwich. Ingredients: Baguette, grilled pork or chicken, pickled carrots and daikon, cucumber, cilantro, mayonnaise, jalapeños, pâté. Instructions: 1. Slice baguette lengthwise. 2. Spread a layer of pâté and mayonnaise. 3. Fill with grilled meat, pickled vegetables, fresh cucumber slices, cilantro, and jalapeños. Serve immediately.

Recipe: Korean - Kimchi Jjigae. A spicy kimchi stew. Ingredients: 2 cups aged kimchi, 200g pork belly, 1/2 block tofu, scallions, gochugaru (chili flakes), gochujang (chili paste), anchovy broth. Instructions: 1. Sauté pork belly with chopped kimchi. 2. Add anchovy broth, gochugaru, and gochujang. Bring to a boil. 3. Simmer for 20-30 minutes. 4. Add sliced tofu and scallions. Cook for another 5 minutes.

Recipe: German - Wiener Schnitzel. A thin, breaded, pan-fried veal cutlet. Ingredients: 4 veal cutlets (pounded very thin), flour, 2 eggs, breadcrumbs, lemon wedges, butter or oil for frying. Instructions: 1. Set up three dishes: one with flour, one with beaten eggs, and one with breadcrumbs. 2. Dredge each veal cutlet in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs, pressing gently. 3. Pan-fry in hot butter/oil for 2-3 minutes per side until golden brown. 4. Serve immediately with a lemon wedge.

Recipe: Brazilian - Pão de Queijo. Brazilian cheese bread. Ingredients: 500g tapioca flour, 250ml milk, 100ml vegetable oil, 2 eggs, 150g Parmesan cheese (grated), salt. Instructions: 1. In a saucepan, bring milk and oil to a boil. 2. Pour the hot liquid over the tapioca flour and mix. Let it cool slightly. 3. Beat in the eggs one at a time. 4. Stir in the cheese and salt. 5. Roll the dough into small balls and place on a baking sheet. 6. Bake at 200°C (400°F) for 15-20 minutes until puffed and golden.

Recipe: Peruvian - Ceviche. Fish cured in citrus juices. Ingredients: 500g fresh white fish (e.g., sea bass, cut into cubes), 1 cup fresh lime juice, 1 red onion (thinly sliced), 1 aji limo or habanero chili (minced), chopped cilantro. Instructions: 1. In a glass bowl, combine fish, lime juice, and chili. The acid will 'cook' the fish. 2. Let it marinate for 15-20 minutes. 3. Gently stir in red onion and cilantro. 4. Season with salt. Serve immediately with sweet potato and corn.

Recipe: English - Fish and Chips. A classic comfort food. Ingredients: 4 large white fish fillets (cod or haddock), 1 cup flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 cup beer, potatoes for chips, oil for frying. Instructions: 1. Cut potatoes into thick chips and fry until soft but not browned. Set aside. 2. Make the batter by whisking flour, baking powder, and beer. 3. Pat fish dry, dredge in flour, then dip in the batter. 4. Deep-fry the fish for 5-7 minutes until golden and crispy. 5. Increase oil temperature and fry the chips again until golden and crisp. Serve with salt and vinegar.

Recipe: Russian - Borscht. A sour soup popular in Eastern Europe. Ingredients: 500g beef, 3 beetroots, 2 potatoes, 1 carrot, 1 onion, cabbage, tomato paste, vinegar, dill, sour cream. Instructions: 1. Make a beef broth. 2. Sauté onion and carrot. Grate beetroots and add to the pan with tomato paste and a splash of vinegar. 3. Chop potatoes and cabbage. 4. Add all vegetables to the broth and simmer until tender. 5. Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream and fresh dill.

Recipe: Moroccan - Couscous Royale. A festive dish with various meats and vegetables. Ingredients: Couscous, lamb, chicken, merguez sausage, turnips, carrots, zucchini, chickpeas, harissa, spices (ras el hanout). Instructions: 1. Steam the couscous until fluffy. 2. Make a stew by simmering the lamb and chicken with vegetables and spices until tender. 3. Grill the merguez sausages. 4. Serve the fluffy couscous topped with the stew and sausages. Offer harissa on the side for spiciness.

Recipe: Turkish - Lahmacun. A thin, crispy flatbread topped with minced meat. Ingredients: For dough: flour, water, yeast, salt. For topping: 250g ground lamb, 1 tomato, 1 green pepper, 1 onion, parsley, paprika. Instructions: 1. Make a simple yeast dough and let it rise. 2. Finely chop the topping ingredients and mix with the ground lamb and spices. 3. Roll out the dough into very thin circles. 4. Spread a thin layer of the meat mixture on top. 5. Bake in a very hot oven (250°C / 480°F) for 5-7 minutes. Serve with a squeeze of lemon.

Recipe: Indonesian - Satay Ayam. Grilled chicken skewers with peanut sauce. Ingredients: 500g chicken thigh (cubed). For marinade: kecap manis, turmeric, coriander. For Peanut Sauce: 1 cup roasted peanuts, garlic, chili, palm sugar, tamarind water, kecap manis. Instructions: 1. Marinate chicken for at least 1 hour. Thread onto skewers. 2. Make the peanut sauce by blending all ingredients until smooth. 3. Grill the chicken skewers until cooked through, basting with marinade. 4. Serve hot with peanut sauce, rice cakes, and sliced cucumber.

Recipe: Italian - Lasagna Bolognese. A baked pasta dish with layers of meat sauce and béchamel. Ingredients: Lasagna sheets, 500g ground beef, soffritto (onion, carrot, celery), red wine, tomato passata, milk, Béchamel sauce, Parmesan cheese. Instructions: 1. Make a classic Bolognese sauce by simmering beef with soffritto, wine, and tomato for 2-3 hours. 2. Make a Béchamel sauce. 3. In a baking dish, layer Bolognese, lasagna sheets, and Béchamel. Repeat. 4. Top with Béchamel and a generous amount of Parmesan. 5. Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 30-40 minutes.

Recipe: Japanese - Ramen. A noodle soup dish. Ingredients: Ramen noodles, rich broth (pork, chicken, or vegetable), chashu pork, soft-boiled egg (ajitama), scallions, nori. Instructions: 1. Prepare the broth, which can take many hours. 2. Prepare toppings like chashu pork and marinated eggs. 3. Cook ramen noodles according to package directions. 4. Assemble the bowl: add tare (seasoning base) to the bottom, pour in hot broth, add noodles, and arrange toppings.

Recipe: Mexican - Enchiladas Verdes. Corn tortillas filled with chicken and covered in green salsa. Ingredients: 12 corn tortillas, 500g shredded chicken, 500g tomatillos, 1 onion, 2 serrano chilies, garlic, cilantro, crema, queso fresco. Instructions: 1. Make the salsa verde by boiling and blending tomatillos, chilies, onion, garlic, and cilantro. 2. Lightly fry tortillas to soften them. 3. Dip each tortilla in the warm salsa, fill with shredded chicken, and roll it up. 4. Place in a baking dish, pour remaining salsa over the top, and sprinkle with cheese. 5. Bake until bubbly and serve with crema.

Recipe: Indian - Chana Masala. A spicy chickpea curry. Ingredients: 2 cans (400g each) chickpeas, 1 large onion, 2 tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, ground coriander, cumin, turmeric, garam masala, amchur (dried mango powder). Instructions: 1. Sauté onion until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute. 2. Add finely chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. 3. Add all powdered spices and cook for another minute. 4. Add the chickpeas (with their liquid) and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Mash some chickpeas to thicken the gravy. Garnish with cilantro.

Recipe: Thai - Tom Yum Goong. A hot and sour shrimp soup. Ingredients: 500g shrimp, 1L chicken stock, lemongrass, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, mushrooms, fish sauce, lime juice, chili paste. Instructions: 1. Bring chicken stock to a boil. 2. Add lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves. Simmer for 10 minutes. 3. Add mushrooms and shrimp. Cook until shrimp turns pink. 4. Remove from heat. Season with fish sauce, lime juice, and chili paste to taste. Garnish with cilantro.

Recipe: French - Onion Soup. A classic soup topped with cheese and croutons. Ingredients: 1kg onions (thinly sliced), 1.5L beef broth, 50g butter, dry white wine, baguette slices, Gruyère cheese. Instructions: 1. Slowly caramelize the onions in butter for 30-40 minutes until deep brown and sweet. 2. Deglaze the pot with white wine. 3. Add beef broth and simmer for at least 30 minutes. 4. Ladle soup into oven-safe bowls. Top with a slice of toasted baguette and a generous amount of Gruyère. 5. Broil until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Recipe: Spanish - Tortilla Española. A Spanish omelette with potatoes and onions. Ingredients: 5 large potatoes, 1 large onion, 6 eggs, olive oil, salt. Instructions: 1. Thinly slice potatoes and onion. 2. In a generous amount of olive oil, slowly cook the potatoes and onions on low heat until very soft. Drain well. 3. Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Add the cooked potato and onion mixture and salt. 4. In a non-stick pan, cook half the mixture until the bottom is set. Flip using a plate and cook the other side. Repeat for a second tortilla or make one large one.

Recipe: Greek - Souvlaki. Grilled skewers of meat. Ingredients: 500g pork or chicken (cubed), olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, garlic. For serving: pita bread, tzatziki sauce, tomatoes, onions. Instructions: 1. Marinate the meat in olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, and garlic for at least 2 hours. 2. Thread the meat onto skewers. 3. Grill or broil the skewers until cooked through and slightly charred. 4. Serve in warm pita bread with tzatziki, tomatoes, and onions.

Recipe: Chinese - Cantonese Steamed Fish. A delicate and clean-tasting dish. Ingredients: 1 whole white fish (e.g., sea bass), ginger, scallions, light soy sauce, sesame oil, vegetable oil. Instructions: 1. Place slices of ginger and scallion inside and under the fish. 2. Steam the fish over high heat for 8-10 minutes until just cooked. 3. Discard steaming water, ginger, and scallions. 4. Top the fish with fresh julienned ginger and scallions. 5. Heat soy sauce, sesame oil, and vegetable oil until very hot. Carefully pour the hot oil over the fish. The scallions will sizzle.

Recipe: American - BBQ Ribs. Slow-cooked pork ribs with a smoky sauce. Ingredients: 1 rack of pork ribs. For rub: brown sugar, paprika, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper. For BBQ sauce: ketchup, apple cider vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar. Instructions: 1. Apply the dry rub all over the ribs. 2. Wrap in foil and bake at a low temperature (150°C / 300°F) for 2-3 hours until tender. 3. Unwrap, brush generously with BBQ sauce. 4. Finish on a hot grill or under the broiler for a few minutes to caramelize the sauce.

Recipe: Jamaican - Jerk Chicken. A spicy grilled chicken dish. Ingredients: 1 whole chicken, cut into pieces. For marinade: scallions, Scotch bonnet peppers, allspice, thyme, soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger. Instructions: 1. Blend all marinade ingredients to make a paste. 2. Rub the marinade all over the chicken and let it marinate for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight. 3. Grill the chicken over medium heat, traditionally over pimento wood, until cooked through and charred in places.

Recipe: Ethiopian - Doro Wat. A spicy chicken stew. Ingredients: 1 kg chicken pieces, 4 large onions (finely chopped), berbere spice mix, niter kibbeh (spiced clarified butter), hard-boiled eggs. Instructions: 1. Slowly cook the onions in a dry pot for a long time until they break down. 2. Add niter kibbeh and berbere spice, and cook until fragrant. 3. Add the chicken pieces and a little water. Simmer for about an hour until the chicken is tender. 4. Add peeled hard-boiled eggs to the stew during the last 10 minutes. Serve with injera bread.

Recipe: Argentinian - Chimichurri Steak. Grilled steak with a vibrant herb sauce. Ingredients: 1 large steak (e.g., sirloin, flank). For Chimichurri: 1 cup parsley, 4 cloves garlic, 1/2 cup olive oil, 1/4 cup red wine vinegar, 1 tsp dried oregano, red pepper flakes. Instructions: 1. Make the chimichurri by finely chopping parsley and garlic and whisking with the other sauce ingredients. 2. Grill the steak to your desired doneness. 3. Let the steak rest for 10 minutes, then slice. 4. Serve the steak generously topped with chimichurri sauce.

Recipe: Irish - Colcannon. A classic Irish dish of mashed potatoes with cabbage or kale. Ingredients: 1kg potatoes, 250g kale or cabbage (shredded), 1 cup milk, 1/2 cup butter, scallions. Instructions: 1. Boil and mash the potatoes. 2. While potatoes are cooking, simmer the kale/cabbage in milk until tender. 3. Add the milk and greens mixture, butter, and chopped scallions to the mashed potatoes. Mix well and season.

Recipe: Swedish - Köttbullar (Meatballs). Served with gravy, lingonberry jam, and potatoes. Ingredients: 500g mixed ground beef and pork, 1/2 cup breadcrumbs, 1/2 cup milk, 1 onion (finely chopped), 1 egg, allspice. For gravy: beef broth, cream, flour. Instructions: 1. Soak breadcrumbs in milk. 2. Sauté onion until soft. 3. Mix ground meat with the breadcrumb mixture, onion, egg, and spices. 4. Roll into small meatballs and pan-fry until browned. 5. Make a simple gravy in the same pan using pan drippings, flour, broth, and cream.

Recipe: Hungarian - Goulash. A rich stew of meat and vegetables, seasoned with paprika. Ingredients: 1kg beef (cubed), 2 large onions, 3 tbsp sweet paprika, 2 carrots, 2 potatoes, 1 bell pepper, caraway seeds, beef broth. Instructions: 1. Sauté onions until soft. Stir in paprika off the heat. 2. Brown the beef in the pot. 3. Add caraway seeds, broth, and cover. Simmer for 1.5 hours. 4. Add chopped carrots, potatoes, and bell pepper. Cook for another 45 minutes until everything is tender.

Recipe: Polish - Pierogi. Dumplings with various fillings. Ingredients: For dough: 2 cups flour, 1 egg, 1/2 cup warm water. For filling: 500g potatoes, 200g farmer's cheese, 1 onion. Instructions: 1. Make the dough and let it rest. 2. For the filling, boil and mash potatoes. Sauté onion and mix with mashed potatoes and cheese. 3. Roll out the dough, cut circles, place a spoonful of filling, and seal into a half-moon shape. 4. Boil the pierogi until they float. 5. Serve boiled or pan-fried with sour cream and more sautéed onions.

Recipe: Belgian - Moules-Frites. Mussels with fries. Ingredients: 2kg fresh mussels, 1 cup dry white wine, 2 shallots (chopped), parsley, celery, butter, potatoes for fries. Instructions: 1. Prepare fries as in the Fish and Chips recipe. 2. In a large pot, melt butter and sauté shallots and celery until soft. 3. Add cleaned mussels and white wine. 4. Cover and steam for 5-7 minutes, shaking the pot occasionally, until all mussels have opened. Discard any that remain closed. 5. Stir in parsley and serve immediately with the hot fries.

Recipe: Filipino - Chicken Adobo. A savory and tangy stew. Ingredients: 1kg chicken pieces, 1/2 cup soy sauce, 1/2 cup white vinegar, 1 head of garlic (minced), 1 tsp black peppercorns, 2 bay leaves. Instructions: 1. Combine all ingredients in a pot. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes. 2. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes until chicken is tender and the sauce has reduced. 3. Optional: Pan-fry the chicken after simmering for a crispy skin.

Recipe: South African - Bobotie. A spiced minced meat dish with a creamy egg topping. Ingredients: 500g ground beef, 1 slice of bread (soaked in milk), 1 onion, 1 tbsp curry powder, 1/4 cup raisins, chutney, flaked almonds. For topping: 1 cup milk, 2 eggs. Instructions: 1. Sauté onion, add beef and curry powder. 2. Squeeze milk from bread and add the bread to the meat mixture, along with raisins and chutney. 3. Place in a baking dish. 4. Whisk eggs and milk for the topping and pour over the meat. Top with almonds. 5. Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 30-35 minutes.

Recipe: Italian - Pesto Genovese. A bright basil sauce. Ingredients: 2 cups fresh basil leaves, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan, 1/4 cup pine nuts, 2 cloves garlic, 1/2 cup olive oil, salt. Instructions: 1. Toast pine nuts lightly. 2. In a food processor or mortar and pestle, combine basil, pine nuts, garlic, and Parmesan. 3. Pulse or grind until a paste forms. 4. Slowly stream in the olive oil while processing until the sauce is smooth. Season with salt. Toss with pasta.

Recipe: Japanese - Tempura. Lightly battered and deep-fried seafood and vegetables. Ingredients: Shrimp, assorted vegetables (sweet potato, eggplant, broccoli), 1 cup cake flour, 1 egg, 1 cup ice-cold water, oil for frying. Instructions: 1. Prepare vegetables and shrimp. 2. Make the batter by lightly mixing the flour, egg, and ice water. It should be lumpy. 3. Heat oil to 180°C (350°F). 4. Dip seafood and vegetables in the batter and deep-fry for 2-3 minutes until lightly golden. Do not overcrowd the pan. Serve with a dipping sauce.

Recipe: Mexican - Chiles Rellenos. Stuffed poblano peppers. Ingredients: 4 large poblano peppers, 500g Oaxaca or mozzarella cheese, 2 eggs (separated), 1/4 cup flour. For sauce: 4 tomatoes, 1/2 onion, 1 clove garlic. Instructions: 1. Roast the poblano peppers until the skin is blistered. Let them sweat in a bag, then peel the skin. 2. Make a slit in each pepper and stuff with cheese. 3. Make the batter by beating egg whites until stiff, then folding in the yolks. 4. Dust the stuffed peppers with flour, dip in the egg batter, and pan-fry until golden. 5. Serve with a simple tomato sauce.

Recipe: Indian - Samosas. A fried pastry with a savory filling. Ingredients: For dough: 2 cups flour, 4 tbsp oil, water. For filling: 3 large potatoes (boiled and mashed), 1 cup green peas, onion, ginger, cumin seeds, coriander powder, garam masala. Instructions: 1. Make a stiff dough and let it rest. 2. Sauté cumin seeds, onion, and ginger. Add peas and mashed potatoes. Stir in spices. 3. Roll out the dough, cut into semi-circles, form into a cone, fill with the potato mixture, and seal. 4. Deep-fry on medium-low heat until golden and crispy.

Recipe: Thai - Massaman Curry. A rich, mild Thai curry. Ingredients: 500g beef or chicken, 400ml coconut milk, 2 tbsp Massaman curry paste, 2 potatoes (cubed), 1 onion, 1/4 cup roasted peanuts, fish sauce, tamarind paste, palm sugar. Instructions: 1. Sauté the curry paste in coconut cream until fragrant. 2. Add the beef/chicken and brown it. 3. Add the rest of the coconut milk, potatoes, and onion. Simmer until the meat and potatoes are tender. 4. Season with fish sauce, tamarind paste, and palm sugar. Stir in roasted peanuts before serving.

Recipe: French - Crème Brûlée. A rich custard base topped with a layer of hardened caramelized sugar. Ingredients: 2 cups heavy cream, 1 vanilla bean, 5 egg yolks, 1/2 cup sugar. Instructions: 1. Heat cream with the vanilla bean. 2. Whisk egg yolks and sugar until pale. 3. Slowly temper the hot cream into the yolk mixture. 4. Strain the custard and pour into ramekins. 5. Bake in a water bath at 160°C (325°F) for 30-40 minutes until set. 6. Chill completely. Just before serving, sprinkle a thin layer of sugar on top and caramelize with a kitchen torch.

Recipe: Spanish - Gazpacho. A cold vegetable soup. Ingredients: 1kg ripe tomatoes, 1 cucumber, 1 green bell pepper, 1/2 red onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1/4 cup olive oil, 2 tbsp sherry vinegar, stale bread. Instructions: 1. Roughly chop all vegetables. 2. In a blender, combine vegetables, bread, garlic, olive oil, and vinegar. 3. Blend until very smooth. Add cold water to reach desired consistency. 4. Season with salt. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.

Recipe: Greek - Dolmades. Stuffed grape leaves. Ingredients: 50-60 preserved grape leaves, 1 cup long-grain rice, 1 onion, fresh parsley, mint, dill, 1/2 cup olive oil, juice of 2 lemons. Instructions: 1. Sauté onion, then add rice and herbs. Cook for a few minutes. 2. Place a small amount of filling on each grape leaf and roll it up tightly. 3. Arrange the rolled leaves snugly in a pot. 4. Pour olive oil, lemon juice, and water over them. 5. Place a plate on top to keep them submerged. Simmer on low heat for 45-60 minutes.

Recipe: Chinese - Char Siu (Chinese BBQ Pork). A popular way to flavor and prepare barbecued pork. Ingredients: 1kg pork shoulder or belly, 1/2 cup hoisin sauce, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup honey, 2 tbsp Shaoxing wine, five-spice powder, red food coloring (optional). Instructions: 1. Mix all marinade ingredients. 2. Marinate the pork for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight. 3. Roast at 200°C (400°F) for 20 minutes. 4. Baste with remaining marinade, reduce heat to 180°C (350°F) and roast for another 20-30 minutes, basting occasionally, until cooked through and caramelized.

Recipe: American - Apple Pie. A classic dessert. Ingredients: For crust: 2.5 cups flour, 1 cup cold butter, ice water. For filling: 8 apples (peeled and sliced), 3/4 cup sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon juice, 2 tbsp flour. Instructions: 1. Make the pie crust by cutting butter into flour, then adding just enough ice water to form a dough. Chill. 2. Mix apples with sugar, spices, lemon juice, and flour. 3. Roll out half the dough and line a pie dish. Add the filling. 4. Roll out the other half for the top crust. Crimp the edges and cut vents. 5. Bake at 200°C (400°F) for 45-55 minutes until the crust is golden and the filling is bubbly.

Recipe: Cuban - Ropa Vieja. Shredded beef in a savory tomato sauce. Ingredients: 1kg beef flank or skirt steak, 1 large onion, 1 bell pepper, 2 cloves garlic, 1 can crushed tomatoes, olives, cumin, oregano. Instructions: 1. Simmer the beef in water until very tender (about 2 hours). Let it cool and shred it with two forks. 2. Sauté onion and pepper, then add garlic. 3. Stir in crushed tomatoes, olives, and spices. 4. Add the shredded beef and some of the cooking liquid. Simmer for 30 minutes. Serve with rice and black beans.

Recipe: Portuguese - Bacalhau à Brás. A dish made from shredded salt cod, potatoes, and eggs. Ingredients: 300g salt cod (soaked), 500g potatoes (cut into thin matchsticks), 1 onion, 4 eggs, parsley, black olives. Instructions: 1. Desalt the cod by soaking it in water for 24-48 hours, changing the water frequently. Then poach and shred it. 2. Fry the potato matchsticks until crisp. 3. Sauté thinly sliced onion until soft. Add the shredded cod and cook for a few minutes. 4. Add the fried potatoes. 5. Lightly beat the eggs and pour them over the mixture, stirring gently until the eggs are just set. 6. Garnish with parsley and black olives.

Recipe: Austrian - Apfelstrudel (Apple Strudel). A layered pastry dessert with a sweet apple filling. Ingredients: For dough: Strudel dough or phyllo pastry. For filling: 1kg apples (sliced), 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 cup raisins, 1/2 cup breadcrumbs (toasted in butter), cinnamon. Instructions: 1. Sauté breadcrumbs in butter until golden. 2. Mix apples with sugar, cinnamon, and raisins. 3. Stretch the dough very thin or lay out phyllo sheets, brushing with butter. 4. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs, then spread the apple filling. 5. Roll up the strudel carefully. Brush with melted butter. 6. Bake at 190°C (375°F) for 30-40 minutes until golden. Serve warm with powdered sugar.

Recipe: Canadian - Poutine. A dish of french fries and cheese curds topped with a brown gravy. Ingredients: 1kg potatoes for fries, 2 cups cheese curds, oil for frying. For gravy: 2 tbsp cornstarch, 2 tbsp cold water, 4 tbsp butter, 1/4 cup flour, 2 cans beef broth, pepper. Instructions: 1. Make french fries. 2. Make the gravy: melt butter, whisk in flour. Gradually whisk in beef broth and bring to a simmer. Thicken with a cornstarch slurry. Season with pepper. 3. Assemble: Place hot fries in a bowl, scatter cheese curds on top, and pour hot gravy over everything so the cheese melts slightly.

Recipe: Malaysian - Nasi Lemak. A fragrant rice dish cooked in coconut milk and pandan leaf. Ingredients: 2 cups rice, 2 cups coconut milk, pandan leaves. For Sambal: dried chilies, shallots, garlic, shrimp paste (belacan), tamarind juice, sugar. Toppings: fried anchovies (ikan bilis), peanuts, hard-boiled egg, cucumber slices. Instructions: 1. Cook rice with coconut milk and pandan leaves. 2. Make the sambal by blending and then simmering the ingredients until the oil separates. 3. Serve the coconut rice with a spoonful of sambal and all the various toppings.

Recipe: Korean - Bulgogi. Thinly sliced marinated beef, grilled. Ingredients: 500g beef sirloin (very thinly sliced). For marinade: 1/2 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup pear juice or grated pear, 2 tbsp sugar, 2 tbsp sesame oil, garlic, ginger, scallions. Instructions: 1. Mix all marinade ingredients. 2. Add the beef and marinate for at least 30 minutes. 3. Grill or pan-fry the beef in batches on high heat until cooked through and slightly caramelized. Serve with rice and lettuce wraps.

Recipe: Egyptian - Koshari. A popular street food with rice, macaroni, and lentils topped with a spicy tomato sauce and fried onions. Ingredients: 1 cup rice, 1 cup brown lentils, 1 cup small macaroni, 1 can chickpeas. For sauce: 1 can tomato sauce, garlic, vinegar, chili. For topping: 2 onions (thinly sliced and fried until crispy). Instructions: 1. Cook rice, lentils, and macaroni separately. 2. Make the sauce by simmering tomato sauce with garlic, vinegar, and chili. 3. To serve, layer rice, lentils, and macaroni in a bowl. Top with chickpeas, a generous amount of sauce, and crispy fried onions.

Recipe: Lebanese - Tabbouleh. A fresh herb and bulgur salad. Ingredients: 1 cup finely chopped parsley, 1/2 cup finely chopped mint, 1/2 cup fine bulgur wheat, 2 tomatoes (diced), 1 small onion (finely diced), juice of 2 lemons, 1/2 cup olive oil, salt. Instructions: 1. Soak the bulgur in water for 10-15 minutes, then squeeze out all excess water. 2. In a large bowl, combine the parsley, mint, tomatoes, and onion. 3. Add the soaked bulgur. 4. Dress with lemon juice and olive oil. Season with salt. Mix well and let the flavors meld for 30 minutes.

Recipe: Singaporean - Hainanese Chicken Rice. Poached chicken and seasoned rice. Ingredients: 1 whole chicken, ginger, garlic, scallions, pandan leaves. For rice: chicken fat, chicken stock from poaching, jasmine rice. For chili sauce: red chilies, garlic, ginger, lime juice, chicken stock. Instructions: 1. Poach the whole chicken with ginger, garlic, and scallions until just cooked. Plunge into an ice bath to create a gelatinous skin. 2. Cook the rice with chicken fat and the poaching liquid. 3. Make the chili sauce. 4. Slice the chicken and serve over the fragrant rice with the chili sauce, soy sauce, and cucumber slices.

Recipe: Swiss - Cheese Fondue. A melted cheese dish served in a communal pot. Ingredients: 400g Gruyère cheese (grated), 200g Emmental cheese (grated), 1 clove garlic, 1.5 cups dry white wine, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 1 tbsp kirsch (cherry brandy), nutmeg, bread cubes for dipping. Instructions: 1. Rub the inside of a fondue pot with the cut side of a garlic clove. 2. Heat the white wine in the pot until simmering. 3. Gradually add the grated cheeses, stirring constantly until melted and smooth. 4. Mix cornstarch with kirsch and stir into the cheese to thicken. 5. Season with nutmeg. Serve immediately with bread cubes for dipping.

Recipe: Italian - Pizza Margherita. The classic Neapolitan pizza. Ingredients: For dough: 500g '00' flour, yeast, water, salt. For topping: San Marzano tomatoes, fresh mozzarella cheese, fresh basil leaves, olive oil. Instructions: 1. Make the pizza dough and let it ferment. 2. Stretch the dough into a thin circle. 3. Crush tomatoes by hand and spread a thin layer over the dough. 4. Tear fresh mozzarella and scatter it over the tomatoes. 5. Bake in a very hot oven (as hot as it can go) for 5-8 minutes, until the crust is puffed and charred in spots. 6. Top with fresh basil leaves and a drizzle of olive oil.

Recipe: Japanese - Tonkatsu. A breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet. Ingredients: 2 thick pork loin cutlets, salt, pepper, flour, 1 egg, panko breadcrumbs, oil for frying, tonkatsu sauce for serving. Instructions: 1. Season the pork cutlets with salt and pepper. 2. Set up a breading station: flour, beaten egg, and panko. 3. Dredge each cutlet in flour, dip in egg, and coat thoroughly with panko, pressing gently. 4. Deep-fry at 170°C (340°F) for 5-8 minutes per side, until golden brown and cooked through. 5. Let it rest for a few minutes, then slice. Serve with tonkatsu sauce and shredded cabbage.

Recipe: Mexican - Mole Poblano. A rich, complex sauce with chilies and chocolate. Ingredients: A mix of dried chilies (ancho, pasilla, mulato), nuts, seeds, spices, a small amount of dark chocolate, chicken or turkey. Instructions: 1. Toast and rehydrate the dried chilies. 2. Toast nuts and seeds (almonds, peanuts, sesame seeds). 3. Blend the chilies, nuts, seeds, and spices (like cinnamon, cloves) with tomatoes and onion to form a paste. 4. Cook this paste in lard or oil for a long time, gradually adding broth, until it becomes a deep, rich sauce. 5. Stir in chocolate at the end. Serve over cooked chicken or turkey.

Recipe: Indian - Biryani. A layered rice and meat dish. Ingredients: 500g chicken or lamb, 2 cups basmati rice, yogurt, onions, ginger-garlic paste, mint, cilantro, saffron, whole spices (cardamom, cloves, cinnamon). Instructions: 1. Par-boil the rice until 70% cooked. 2. Marinate the meat in yogurt and spices. 3. In a heavy-bottomed pot, layer fried onions, the marinated meat, par-boiled rice, mint, cilantro, and saffron-infused milk. 4. Seal the pot and cook on very low heat (dum cooking) for 30-40 minutes until everything is cooked through and fragrant.

Recipe: Thai - Som Tum (Green Papaya Salad). A spicy and tangy salad. Ingredients: 1 green papaya (shredded), 2-3 bird's eye chilies, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tbsp dried shrimp, 2 tbsp roasted peanuts, snake beans, cherry tomatoes. For dressing: 3 tbsp fish sauce, 3 tbsp lime juice, 1 tbsp palm sugar. Instructions: 1. In a mortar and pestle, pound the chilies and garlic. 2. Add dried shrimp, peanuts, and snake beans, and bruise them lightly. 3. Add the shredded papaya and cherry tomatoes. 4. Add the dressing ingredients and gently pound and toss everything together to combine the flavors.

Recipe: French - Macarons. Delicate almond meringue cookies with a filling. Ingredients: For shells: 1 cup almond flour, 1.5 cups powdered sugar, 3 egg whites, 1/4 cup granulated sugar. For filling: Buttercream or ganache. Instructions: 1. Sift almond flour and powdered sugar together. 2. Make a French meringue by whipping egg whites and gradually adding granulated sugar until stiff peaks form. 3. Fold the dry ingredients into the meringue in stages until the batter flows like lava (macaronage). 4. Pipe small circles onto a baking sheet. Let them rest for 30-60 minutes until a skin forms. 5. Bake at 150°C (300°F) for 15-18 minutes. 6. Once cool, sandwich two shells together with your desired filling.

Recipe: Spanish - Churros con Chocolate. Fried dough pastries with a thick chocolate dipping sauce. Ingredients: For churros: 1 cup water, 2 tbsp sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 tbsp oil, 1 cup flour, oil for frying. For chocolate: 100g dark chocolate, 1 cup milk, 1 tbsp cornstarch. Instructions: 1. Bring water, sugar, salt, and oil to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in flour until a ball forms. 2. Transfer dough to a piping bag with a star tip. 3. Pipe lengths of dough into hot oil (190°C / 375°F) and fry until golden brown. Roll in cinnamon sugar. 4. Make the dipping sauce by melting chocolate in simmering milk, thickened with a cornstarch slurry.

Recipe: Greek - Avgolemono Soup. A classic Greek lemon and egg soup. Ingredients: 1.5L chicken broth, 1/2 cup orzo or long-grain rice, 2 large eggs, juice of 2 lemons. Shredded cooked chicken is optional. Instructions: 1. Bring chicken broth to a boil and add the orzo or rice. Cook until tender. 2. In a separate bowl, beat the eggs until frothy. 3. Very slowly, whisk the lemon juice into the eggs. 4. Temper the egg mixture by slowly whisking in a ladleful of the hot broth. 5. Pour the tempered egg mixture back into the pot of soup, stirring constantly. 6. Heat gently until the soup thickens slightly but do not let it boil, or the eggs will curdle.

Recipe: Chinese - Peking Duck. A famous duck dish from Beijing known for its thin, crispy skin. At home version: Ingredients: 1 whole duck, maltose syrup or honey, boiling water, five-spice powder, salt. For serving: Mandarin pancakes, hoisin sauce, sliced scallions and cucumber. Instructions: 1. Clean the duck and separate the skin from the meat using air. 2. Blanch the duck with boiling water to tighten the skin. 3. Brush the duck with a mixture of maltose syrup and water. Let it hang and air-dry in a cool place for at least 24 hours. 4. Roast the duck at 180°C (350°F) for 1-1.5 hours until the skin is deep brown and crispy. 5. Carve the skin and meat separately. Serve with pancakes, sauce, and vegetables.

Recipe: American - Gumbo. A hearty stew from Louisiana. Ingredients: For roux: 1 cup flour, 1 cup oil. The 'holy trinity': 1 onion, 1 bell pepper, 2 celery stalks. Chicken, andouille sausage, shrimp, okra, chicken stock, Creole spices. Instructions: 1. Make a dark roux by cooking flour and oil slowly until it's the color of dark chocolate. This takes patience. 2. Add the chopped 'holy trinity' and cook until soft. 3. Gradually stir in chicken stock. 4. Add chicken, sausage, okra, and spices. Simmer for at least 1.5 hours. 5. Add shrimp during the last 10 minutes of cooking. Serve over rice.

Recipe: Australian - Lamingtons. Sponge cake dipped in chocolate icing and coated in desiccated coconut. Ingredients: Plain sponge cake, 4 cups powdered sugar, 1/3 cup cocoa powder, 1/2 cup milk, 2 tbsp butter, 2 cups desiccated coconut. Instructions: 1. Cut the sponge cake into squares. 2. Make the icing by melting butter and mixing with sifted powdered sugar, cocoa, and milk to form a smooth, thin icing. 3. Place coconut in a shallow dish. 4. Dip each cake square into the chocolate icing, ensuring all sides are coated. 5. Immediately roll the coated cake in the desiccated coconut. Let them set on a wire rack.

Recipe: Venezuelan - Arepas. A cornmeal patty that can be filled with various ingredients. Ingredients: 2 cups pre-cooked white cornmeal (masarepa), 2.5 cups warm water, 1 tsp salt. Fillings: shredded beef, black beans, cheese, avocado. Instructions: 1. In a bowl, mix the water and salt. Gradually add the cornmeal, mixing with your hands until a soft, pliable dough forms. 2. Let the dough rest for 5 minutes. 3. Form the dough into discs about 1.5 cm thick. 4. Cook the arepas on a griddle or pan over medium heat for 5-7 minutes per side, until a crust forms. 5. Split the cooked arepas open and stuff with your desired fillings.

Recipe: Danish - Smørrebrød. An open-faced sandwich. Ingredients: A slice of dense rye bread (rugbrød), butter. Toppings can vary widely, e.g., pickled herring with onions; roast beef with remoulade and crispy onions; or shrimp with mayonnaise and dill. Instructions: 1. Butter a slice of rye bread. 2. Artfully arrange your chosen toppings on the bread. 3. Garnish appropriately (e.g., with fresh herbs, lemon slices). Eaten with a knife and fork.

Recipe: Colombian - Bandeja Paisa. A platter with a generous variety of foods. Ingredients: Red beans cooked with pork, white rice, ground meat (carne molida), chicharrón (fried pork belly), a fried egg, plantain (plátano maduro), chorizo, arepa, avocado. Instructions: This is an assembly dish. 1. Cook each component separately: the beans, rice, ground meat, chorizo. 2. Fry the chicharrón, plantain, and egg. 3. Arrange all the components generously on a large platter (bandeja) and serve with a slice of avocado.

Recipe: Finnish - Karjalanpiirakka (Karelian Pies). A traditional pasty with a thin rye crust and a rice porridge filling. Ingredients: For crust: 1 cup rye flour, 1/2 cup water, salt. For filling: 1 cup short-grain rice, 2 cups milk for porridge. For glazing: melted butter. Instructions: 1. Make the rice porridge filling and let it cool. 2. Make a simple rye dough. Roll it out paper-thin into small circles. 3. Spread a spoonful of the rice porridge on each circle, leaving a border. 4. Crimp the edges of the crust up over the filling. 5. Bake at a high temperature (250-275°C / 480-525°F) for 10-15 minutes. 6. Brush the hot pies with melted butter. Often served with egg butter.

Recipe: Israeli - Shakshuka. Eggs poached in a spicy tomato and pepper sauce. Ingredients: 1 can crushed tomatoes, 1 onion, 1 red bell pepper, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp cumin, chili flakes, 4-6 eggs, feta cheese, parsley. Instructions: 1. Sauté onion and bell pepper until soft. Add garlic and spices and cook for another minute. 2. Pour in the crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10-15 minutes until the sauce thickens. 3. Make small wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each one. 4. Cover the pan and cook on low heat for 5-8 minutes, until the egg whites are set but the yolks are still runny. 5. Sprinkle with feta cheese and fresh parsley. Serve with bread for dipping.

Recipe: Mongolian - Buuz. Steamed dumplings filled with meat. Ingredients: For dough: 2 cups flour, 1 cup water. For filling: 500g ground mutton or beef, 1 onion (finely chopped), garlic, salt, caraway seeds. Instructions: 1. Make a simple flour and water dough. 2. Mix the filling ingredients together. 3. Roll out the dough and cut into circles. 4. Place a spoonful of filling in the center of each circle. Fold and pleat the edges to enclose the filling, leaving a small opening at the top. 5. Steam the dumplings for 15-20 minutes. Serve hot.

Recipe: New Zealander - Pavlova. A meringue-based dessert with a crisp crust and soft, light inside. Ingredients: 4 egg whites, 1 cup caster sugar, 1 tsp white vinegar, 1/2 tbsp cornstarch. For topping: whipped cream, fresh fruits (like kiwi, strawberries, passionfruit). Instructions: 1. Beat egg whites until soft peaks form. 2. Gradually add the sugar, beating until the meringue is stiff and glossy. 3. Gently fold in the vinegar and cornstarch. 4. Shape the meringue into a circle on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. 5. Bake at a low temperature (120°C / 250°F) for 1-1.5 hours. Turn off the oven and let it cool completely inside. 6. Top with whipped cream and fresh fruit just before serving.

Recipe: Pakistani - Haleem. A thick stew made of wheat, barley, lentils, and meat. Ingredients: 250g wheat/barley mix, 1 cup mixed lentils, 500g beef or mutton, onions, ginger-garlic paste, Shan Haleem Masala mix or individual spices. Toppings: fried onions, ginger, green chilies, lemon juice. Instructions: 1. Soak grains and lentils overnight. 2. Cook the meat with spices until very tender. Shred the meat. 3. Cook the soaked grains and lentils until they are a thick porridge. 4. Blend the grain mixture until smooth. 5. Combine the shredded meat and the grain porridge. Cook together on low heat for at least an hour, stirring frequently until it reaches a thick, paste-like consistency. 6. Serve hot with toppings.

Recipe: Taiwanese - Bubble Tea. A tea-based drink with chewy tapioca balls. Ingredients: 1/2 cup black tea (strong brew), 1/2 cup tapioca pearls (boba), 1/2 cup milk (or milk substitute), 2-3 tbsp simple syrup or brown sugar syrup. Instructions: 1. Cook the tapioca pearls according to package directions. Rinse and soak them in syrup. 2. Brew the black tea and let it cool. 3. To assemble, add a spoonful of the cooked boba and syrup to the bottom of a tall glass. 4. Add ice, followed by the brewed tea and milk. 5. Stir well. Serve with a wide straw.

Recipe: Brazilian - Feijoada. A black bean stew with pork and beef. Ingredients: 500g black beans, 200g pork shoulder, 200g smoked sausage, 200g beef, 1 onion, garlic, bay leaves, orange slices. Instructions: 1. Soak the beans overnight. 2. In a large pot, sauté onions and garlic until soft. Add the meats and brown them. 3. Add the soaked beans and enough water to cover everything. Add bay leaves and orange slices. 4. Simmer for at least 2-3 hours until the beans are tender and the meat is falling apart. Serve with rice, collard greens, and orange slices.

Recipe: Russian - Borscht. A beet soup with vegetables and meat. Ingredients: 2 medium beets, 1 onion, 1 carrot, 1 potato, 1/2 head of cabbage, 500g beef or pork, 2 tbsp tomato paste, dill, sour cream. Instructions: 1. Boil the meat in water until tender. Remove and shred. 2. In the same broth, add diced beets, onion, carrot, and potato. Cook until tender. 3. Add shredded cabbage and tomato paste. Cook for another 10-15 minutes. 4. Return the shredded meat to the pot. Season with salt and pepper. 5. Serve hot with a dollop of sour cream and fresh dill.
